discussion.content: A, page 291 of the official SOC course: "-n Speed up the process by not performing IP addresses DNS resolution in the Log files"

questions.question_text: What does [-n] in the following checkpoint firewall log syntax represents? fw log [-f [-t]] [-n] [-l] [-o] [-c action] [-h host] [-s starttime] [-e endtime] [-b starttime endtime] [-u unification_scheme_file] [-m unification_mode(initial|semi|raw)] [-a] [-k (alert name|all)] [-g] [logfile]

choices.D: Display detailed log chains (all the log segments a log record consists of)
choices.A: Speed up the process by not performing IP addresses DNS resolution in the Log files
choices.B: Display both the date and the time for each log record

discussion.content: Its the A. https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0045790612001140#:~:text=DHCP%20starvation%20attack%20is%20an,users%20can%20be%20denied%20service. "DHCP starvation attack is an attack that targets DHCP servers whereby forged DHCP requests are crafted by an attacker with the intent of exhausting all available IP addresses that can be allocated by the DHCP server. Under this attack, legitimate network users can be denied service."

questions.question_text: Which of the following attack inundates DHCP servers with fake DHCP requests to exhaust all available IP addresses?

discussion.content: The answer is B according to the official courseware: Module 6 page 707.

ANS:B 
the SOC L1 analyst determines whether the alert is true positive or merely false positive. PG 707

questions.question_text:
Mike is an incident handler for PNP Infosystems Inc. One day, there was a ticket raised regarding a critical incident and Mike was assigned to handle the incident. During the process of incident handling, at one stage, he has performed incident analysis and validation to check whether the incident is a true incident or a false positive.
Identify the stage in which he is currently in.

discussion.content: The answer is B according to the official courseware: Module 6 pages 666, 667 and 668.
YES, It is the B "Preparation -> Incident Recording -> Incident Triage -> Containment -> Eradication -> Recovery -> Post-Incident Activities"

choices.D: Incident Recording –> Preparation –> Containment –> Incident Triage –> Recovery –> Eradication –> Post-Incident Activities
choices.C: Incident Triage –> Eradication –> Containment –> Incident Recording –> Preparation –> Recovery –> Post-Incident Activities
choices.A: Containment –> Incident Recording –> Incident Triage –> Preparation –> Recovery –> Eradication –> Post-Incident Activities
choices.B: Preparation –> Incident Recording –> Incident Triage –> Containment –> Eradication –> Recovery –> Post-Incident Activities

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a correct flow of the stages in an incident handling and response (IH&R) process?
